Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the unemployment rate by stating that it stands at 40% without providing sufficient evidence or support.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to back up the statement that unemployment is currently at 40%.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the current unemployment rate is 40% without providing any data or context to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: Without any evidence or data provided, the claim contradicts the fact that the average minimum wage has only increased by 12% since 2013.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors that contribute to the unemployment rate, but the claim does not explore or acknowledge them.
